About me

Hello! I'm Jonathan, a driven graduate student passionate about devling into the complexities of Computer Science and Software Engineering.

My academic journey as been enriched by hands-on experiences as a research assistant, where I've contributed to projects at the Intelligences Networks Lab and the Cross Reality Sandbox Research Group, and as a devoted teaching assistant, guiding and supporting students in Data Structures, Algorithms, and Discrete Mathematics.

What distinguishes me is my holistic problem-solving approach, blending research expertise with a penchant for innovative solutions. Committed to continuous growth, I eagerly seek opportunities to expand my skills in Software Development, aspiring to bring fresh perspectives and insights to the academic realm. Excited about the journey ahead, I'm keen to connect and collaborate for impactful contributions in Software Development.

During my free time, you can find me in the kitchen crafting new dishes!

View Resume

Projects

Detect it

Detect it is a Video Shot Boundary Detection System that utilizes Python & OpenCV to read videos, extract features via histograms, and set thresholds for transitions. The algorithm consists of a Twin-comparison based approach for precise cut & gradual transition detection. The program then displays the frames to the users via Python GUI that allows for a playback of the specific transtion.

GitHub

Retrieve it

Retrieve it is a Content-Based Image Retrieveal (CBIR) system based on two different color histogram comparison methods (Intensity and Color-Code) with Relevance Feedback. The algorithm consists of utilizing a combination of both intensity + color-code histograms and the Gaussian normalization for feature normalization. The user may select photos they deem relevant to the selected query image and requery for a higher relevance.

GitHub

ChilPass

ChilPass is a password management application that utilizes offline database systems, PBKDF2 key derivation, SHA-256 hashing, and AES encryption. Devoted 400+ hours into this project in 10 weeks.

Developed by: Jonathan Cho and Hans Wilter

GitHub
